results.title: Barbie in the nutcracker
results.creator_credit: Owen Hurley, Jennifer Twiner McCarron, Jesyca C Durchin, Mainframe Entertainment and Mattel
results.brief_description: Superb computer animation brings Barbie to life in this modernized adaptation of E.T.A. Hoffmann’s classic story, ‘The Nutcracker’. Story heroine Clara receives a wooden Nutcracker as a gift from an aunt. As she sleeps the Nutcracker comes to life to save her from the evil Mouse King, who has invaded Clara’s house, unfortunately. Clara wakes and is shrunk by the Mouse King. The only person who can break the Mouse King’s spell and restore Clara to her original size is the Sugarplum Fairy, so Clara and the Nutcracker set off to find her. In her first full length movie, Barbie assumes the roles of Clara and the Sugarplum Fairy. Choreographed by Peter Martins and performed for animation by the New York City Ballet. Tchaikovsky’s musical score is performed by the London Symphony Orchestra. Features voices from Kelly Sheridan (Barbie/Clara), Kirby Morrow (Nutcracker/Prince Eric),Tim Curry (Mouse King), Peter Kelamis (Pimm), Christopher Gaze (Major Mint), Ian James Corlett (Captain Candy), French Tickner (Grandfather Drosselmayer) and Kathleen Barr (Aunt Drosselmayer).

results.title: Bandits [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Michael Birnbaum, Michele Berk, Paula Weinstein and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Escaping from prison in a cement truck, rugged ladies-man Joe (Bruce Willis) and neurotic hypochondriac Terry (Billy Bob Thornton), find themselves criminal celebrities when they come upon a new way of robbing banks - sleeping over at the house of their victims the night before the heist. With paradise firmly in mind - a nightclub in Acapulco - the affable robbers target bank managers, sleep over, then catch a ride into work before robbing it. Their modus operandi garners them the moniker of the “Sleepover bandits.” Trouble ensues when the men separate and make their own way to the rendezvous. Terry runs out of petrol and ends up being “kidnapped” by manic-depressive housewife Kate (Cate Blanchett), who accidentally hits him with her car. Eager to make it up to him and nonplussed at being removed from her loveless marriage, Kate calls herself a bandit too - but not before endearing herself to both men who fall in love with her. Told in flashback and presented as part of a tell all scoop on “Criminals at large”, “Bandits” also features Troy Garity as Joe’s cousin; getaway driver, wannabe stuntman and pursuer of a mystery female hitchhiker. A curious blend of comedy, action and road movie, “Bandits” was originally intended as an adaptation of the Elmore Leonard book of the same name. Instead, the script was completely rewritten by Harvey Peyton (Twin Peaks).

results.title: Bannerfilm
results.creator_credit: Donald Winkler, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Norman Laliberte, one of the most creative designers of banners in North America is shown in his workroom piecing, stitching together, from pieces of varicoloured fabric, figures and symbols reminiscent of ancient pomp and pageantry. Music and movement are used in the film to heighten the effect of the arrangement shaping and growing before your eyes.

results.title: Banker's day
results.brief_description: This film looks at how Australian trading banks function, and the services provide for their clients.

results.title: Banaras: steps to heaven
results.brief_description: The most sacred of India’s cities, Banaras is the meeting place of heaven and earth. For over two-thousand five hundred years pilgrims have journeyed to Banaras to bathe in the River Ganges and to be cremated on its banks, and the film explores the spiritual forces that have ensured the survival of Banaras over thousands of years of history.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: Wish fairies
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Paul Faint, Tammy Burnstock, Virginia Lumsden and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 dress up as Wish Fairies so that they can secretly make wishes come true for the Teddies. Meanwhile the Rat in the Hat discovers the fairies and schemes to catch them so he can sell the wishes in his shop. Includes five other Bananas in Pyjamas stories.

results.title: Banjo Paterson: the bush balladeer
results.brief_description: Scenes from the Australian high country and the recogniseable voice of Leonard Teale bring sixteen of Banjo Paterson’s stories to life. Included on this tape are; “Clancy of the overflow”, “The Man from Ironbark”, “Waltzing Matilda”, “Santa in the bush”, “Swagman’s rest”, “Mulga Bill’s bicycle”, “The Melting of the snow”, “The Man from Snowy River”, “The Road to Gundagai”, “Ghost of the murderer’s hut”, “The Pearl diver”, “The Geebung polo club”, “In re a gentleman one”, “The Amateur rider”, A Mountain station”, and “The Bush christening”. There are short interludes between each story to allow discussion, as a well as a brief introduction about Banjo Paterson before the stories are recounted.

results.title: Bananas in pyjamas: the big parade
results.creator_credit: Di Drew, Tammy Burnstock and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: B1 and B2 are always on the lookout for fun while the Teddies and Rat in a Hat are always ready to join in. Life is full of surprises in Cuddles Avenue. There are ten stories in this compilation which include: Pink spots; Rat’s hat; Big parade; Pony ride; Magic lamp; Salon rat; Play time; Treasure hunt, Fire fire and Circus time. In the title episode, B1, B2 and all their friends make their very own circus parade.

results.title: Bangers. Feeling sexy
results.creator_credit: Andrew Upton, Davida Allen, Cate Blanchett, Glenys Rowe, Binnaburra Film Company and Pacific Film and Television Commission.
results.brief_description: Bangers (1998, 9 min)- Julie-Anne (Cate Blanchett) comes home from a hard day at the office to discover that her mother (Lynette Curran) has locked the cat in the house all day and that she is expected to cook ‘bangers’ for dinner. Preparing the meal becomes a manifestation of all the repressed tension in Julie-Anne’s work and home life. “Feeling sexy” (1998, 50 min)- This film is renowned painter Davida Allen’s first feature film. Vicki (Susie Porter) is a passionate and vivacious artist whose love for lust and life is slowly being stifled by domestic doldrums. Unable to elicit appropriate responses from her doctor husband Greg (Tamblyn Lord), Vicki embarks on a carnal affair with art student Hugo. When Vicki confesses her indiscretion to Greg, punishment comes in the shape of a blue-heeler who nearly destroys the house and Vicki’s psyche. Novelty being the spice of life, Vicki will have to call on all the resources of her creativity and imagination to coax Greg along on the path to restoring their relationship.

results.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre: ochres
results.creator_credit: Stephen Burstow, ABC-TV (Australia) and Bangarra Dance Theatre
results.brief_description: Recorded during the 1996 Festival of Perth, this production is an exemplary work from the dancers and musicians of the Bangarra Dance Theatre Company, Australia, acclaimed for its fusion of contemporary dance and indigenous traditional styles as well as original musical scores. The performance is centred around the substance Ochres, a material with both physical and spiritual purposes in traditional and urban Aboriginal culture, and from which Stephen Page drew inspiration for his original creation of the choreography for the production in 1994. The dance performance is structured around the characteristics, qualities and variety of symbolic significances of the substance. Divided into 5 parts, it begins with the spirit of Ochres, ‘the light’, then the performance shifts to a study of Ochres’ four essential colours; yellow, black, red and white. The performance features Bangarra Dance Theatre Company artists Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Djakapurra Munyarryun, Russell Page, Albert David, Kathryn Dunn, Frances Rings and Gina Rings in a seamless video capture of a powerful dance work.
